articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: After a slow and chaotic start to the new U.S.-backed aid system in Gaza, thousands of Palestinians have been arriving at distribution points, seeking desperately needed food despite scenes of disorder and fears of violence.
articles.title: Gaza aid system under pressure as thousands seek food

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's government has approved 22 new Jewish settlements in the occupied-West Bank, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said, a move that could deepen divisions with some allies, who have threatened sanctions over further expansion.
articles.title: Israel announces new West Bank settlements despite sanctions threat

articles.author: Samuel Indyk, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Winners on financial markets included chip makers, banks, luxury stocks and the auto industry, all hit hard by tariff-led disruptions.
articles.title: US ruling that Trump tariffs are unlawful stirs relief and uncertainty

articles.author: Steve Holland, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Some Republicans in Congress and White House advisers are urging U.S. President Donald Trump to finally embrace new sanctions on Moscow as frustration mounts over Russian President Vladimir Putin's military assault on Ukraine.
articles.title: Pressure mounting on reluctant Trump to impose sanctions on Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has told families of hostages held in Gaza that Israel has accepted a new ceasefire proposal presented by U.S. President Donald Trump's Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff, Israeli media reported on Thursday.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Israel accepts Witkoff's new Gaza truce proposal, media report

articles.author: Dave Graham
articles.description: The army was deployed and rescue specialists were airlifted in to search for a man still missing on Thursday after a huge chunk of glacier crashed down a mountain in Switzerland, burying much of a picturesque Swiss Alpine village.
articles.title: Army searches for missing man after glacier debris buries Swiss village

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police charged a 53-year-old man on Thursday after a car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool soccer fans during a victory parade earlier this week, injuring dozens.
articles.title: UK police charge man over Liverpool car collision that hurt dozens

articles.author: Laurie Chen, Larissa Liao
articles.description: Chinese students with offers from U.S. universities expressed despair after Washington promised to start "aggressively" revoking Chinese student visas and ordered U.S. missions abroad to stop scheduling new student visa appointments.
articles.title: 'Good days are over': Chinese students despair as US cracks down on visas

articles.author: Ed White
articles.description: Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew said that 17,000 people needed to move quickly.
articles.title: Manitoba urges thousands to evacuate as Canada wildfires spread

articles.author: Raphael Satter
articles.description: The U.S. Treasury is placing under sanctions a Philippines-based company accused of providing internet infrastructure to a swathe of virtual currency investment scams, better known as "pig butchering."
articles.title: US sanctions Philippines digital infrastructure provider linked to virtual currency scams
